column4: My primary and only operating system right now is Ubuntu 10.10, a while back I wiped my hard disk and did a fresh install. However, now I want to play some games that only fair well on windows so I want to install Windows 7. What I want to know is how can I make a partition for Windows, say about 40GB, and also have Ubuntu as my Primary. Also, I'm somewhat of a novice.
on the disc install menu, it gives you an option to create partitions, it isn't really that hard though it may seem it at first
you have which OS installed aleady?
if you install windows, then ubuntu, the LiveCD has a menu page during installation that will allow you to make partitions and a bootloader
